noun.description: A man's headdress, consisting of a long length of cotton or silk wound around a cap or the head, worn especially by Muslims and Sikhs.
A marine mollusk with a sculptured spiral shell and a distinctive operculum which is smooth on the inside and sculptured and typically patterned on the outside.

origin: Mid 16th century: via French from Turkish tülbent, from Persian dulband. Compare with tulip.
